roleset.name: give temporarily

example.name: double object
example.text: Healthcare, which has been in a severe liquidity bind, said it is able to make the payments because it completed a transaction with Greenery Rehabilitation Group Inc. in which Greenery purchased stock and warrants for $500,000 and loaned Healthcare $9 million.

example.name: dative
example.text: South Korean government officials said they don't expect that Seoul can loan money to Warsaw, but it can ``offer experience.''

example.name: args 0 and 2
example.text: The base rate on corporate loans at large U.S. money center commercial banks .
example.arg: at large U.S. money center commercial banks

example.name: purpose for reason for loan
example.text: The current ceiling on home loans insured by the Federal Housing Administration would be increased to $ 124,875

example.name: args 1 and 2
example.text: Thus , the IRS says , the Blandings ' $ 200,000 loan is home - acquisition debt , and interest on it is fully deductible .

example.name: adv for collateral
example.text: The charge on loans to brokers on stock exchange collateral .

roleset.note: LOAN-V NOTES: Frames file for 'loan' based on sentences in wsj and automaticexpansion via verbnet. (from loan.01-v predicate notes)
LOAN-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on loan-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls give-13.1. (from loan.01-n)

roleset.name: like loan.01 but without stated recipient

example.name: toldja so
example.text: That includes the CDBG funds and the Federal Housing Administration, which *trace* loans out money for private home mortgages and has just been discovered to be $4 billion in the hole.

roleset.note: LOAN_OUT-V NOTES: see give class in VN, but verb particle construction is not actually present in that class. (from loan.02-v)
